oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Douglas Ginn, Lillian McGlothlin, Ruth McNish, and Lera Moore, 1976 July 09, excerpt 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with retirement home residents Douglas Ginn, Lillian McGlothlin, Ruth McNish, and Lera Moore, conducted on 9 July 1976 by Ann Wells as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. In this excerpt, Ginn discusses going to the Centennial with family and on dates with her boyfriend. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ginn, Douglas Jones, 1878-1982--Interviews; McGlothlin, Lillian Ferrell, 1888-1982--Interviews; McNish, Ruth Deal, 1893-1982--Interviews; Moore, Lera Bush, 1890-1985--Interviews
